DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Participation Treatment Prior To Screening Completion Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Explanatory term for the reason a patient who was eligible for a clinical trial started treatment prior to completion of trial screening.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Participation Treatment Prior To Screening Completion
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care._A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive therapeutic treatment._Earlier in time or order._A systematic examination or assessment._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._A proposal offered for acceptance or rejection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:Taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The act of taking part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Prior Screening Complete Reason
Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Earlier in time or order.:A systematic examination or assessment.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
